column1: Another  [(1983)  1  WLR  524  at  538-539]  where  the  court  held  that  in  proceedings  for
“[…] there are no formal pleadings and it will frequently be difficult if not impossible
to identify a particular issue which the “first” application will have decided…Further,
we doubt whether a decision in such proceedings, in the sense necessary for issue
estoppel  to  operate,  is  a  final  decision:  the  nature  of  the  relief,  in  many  cases,
leaves open reconsideration by the statutory or other tribunal of the matter in
